page.title: 11Transport
page.content: As far as we could tell the statistics from the 1981 census still hold good.They show 80% of households having a car and as few as 7% of pensioners without access to a car.In such a rural area this is partly necessity,partly a sign of a good standard of living.A bus does link Raskelf to Thirsk,Easingwold and York.Of these Easingwold is the most popular for day to day shopping and York for special shopping, even though it is furthest away at 15 miles.Several superstores are available about 10 miles from the area and an irregular big visit to one was thought a big reason for having a car.
